intro: Peristrophe pantjarensis, commonly known as the Pantjarensis grass, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the Poaceae family, which includes grasses, and is characterized by its slender, tufted growth habit. The plant typically grows in sandy or rocky soils and is adapted to arid or semi-arid environments. Its small, inconspicuous flowers are clustered in panicles, and it plays a role in stabilizing soil in its native habitat. Peristrophe pantjarensis is often found in coastal and inland regions of Western Australia.
